p: The quantitative determination of phytochemical compounds specifies that the T. polium methanolic extract was rich in flavonoids (725 ± 0.001 mg QE/g extract), tannins (239 ± 0.006 mg QE/g extract), and phenols (72 ± 0.011 mg QE/g extract). The obtained T. polium methanolic extract was evaluated for its antioxidant potentiality using four methods. The IC50 of each test was calculated and determined ( Table 4). As it is shown, this extract had the strong radical inhibition of ABTS (IC50 = 0.042 mg/mL) followed by DPPH (IC50 = 0.087 mg/mL), β-carotene/linoleic acid (IC50 = 0.101 mg/mL), and FRAP (IC50 = 0.292 mg/mL).
